children.subject: In terms of assignments, yes, but in terms of time I think 61C takes less time in general by far.
I would say that 61C is worse than CS70 in terms of workload....

history.content:
In my opinion, that schedule honestly seems quite brutal. 61C workload can be quite taxing, and that combined with Math 53 homework and R1B papers sounds like hell (can't speak on 16B since I haven't taken it, but I imagine as a lower div. requirement it has quite a lot of work as well). Here's what I'd do:

If you are a freshman, and considering you want to take CS 70 100% next sem,

Math 53

CS61C

EE 16B

Breadth/light 3-unit class (maybe P/NP), or a DeCal

If you are a sophomore, 

Math 53

61C

R1B

Breadth/light 3-unit class (maybe P/NP), or a DeCal

Hello,

I was thinking of taking CS70, EE16B, Math 53, and R1B next semester, but went against it, because many posts on this forum (especially the instructors) highly discourage taking CS70, without having significant mathematical maturity. Mathematical maturity in this context meaning, having taken EE16A/EE16B, and one of Math53/54(assuming you haven't takenEE16A).

Having said that, I decided to replace CS70 with CS61C, and so I plan on having the following schedule:
- Math 53
- CS61 C
- EE16B
- R1B

What does everyone think of this new schedule? (And if I had to drop a class, so I can only have 2 technicals, then which one should I drop, while still being left with a clear preparation path to taking cs70 next fall?)
history.subject: COURSE SCHEDULE
